revised_title: The Effects of Bacterised Peat and its Fractions on Soil Organisms Involved in the Nitrogen Cycle
tldr: This study investigates the effects of bacterised peat and its fractions on soil organisms involved in the nitrogen cycle. The results show that bacterised peat increases the activity of nitrogen-fixing organisms in the soil, suggesting that it has properties beyond the effects of soluble humates or physical improvements in aeration.
